column4: with broadcom wireless chips, why does Ubuntu by default offer the possibility to install the binary-only drivers via "additional drivers", even though the open-source ones are also available and packaged in the repositories?
because in a lot of instances, the open source ones don't quite get the job done
I thought that in the Broadcom case, the OSS driver is just the one that Broadcom released themselves when they opened up their code?
that doesn't mean they released everything...
